items.sentence: Tom\'s father sold his Buick and bought a Cadillac.
After all day in the sun, Tom had a sunburned nose.
All the girls seem to have fallen in love with Tom.
Tom agreed to meet Mary in front of the laundromat.
It was cold yesterday, but it\'s even colder today.
It was so noisy that I couldn\'t make myself heard.
I have to stay at a hotel near the airport tonight.
I know very little about the the history of Boston.
I love to jog more than anything else in the world.
I never realized how hard it must be to be a woman.
Tom certainly isn\'t as smart as Mary thinks he is.
Tom certainly won\'t ever get another loan from me.
I don\'t have the authority to give you permission.
I don\'t know anyone who knows how to speak French.
I don\'t know her name, but I do know her by sight.
I don\'t know if I can memorize this long password.
I can\'t kiss Tom if he doesn\'t want to be kissed.
I can\'t remember exactly what I\'m supposed to do.
I can\'t seem to get warm. I\'ve been cold all day.
Tom says he can\'t put up with the heat any longer.
